Description:
Stunning Lifestyle & Home In Golf Course Estate
"Just spectacular" is how this home and offered lifestyle has been described. The young home overlooks a dam, fairway and green whiles being surrounded by native vegetation, kangaroos and birdlife. Set in a quiet court in The Goldfields Estate, the occupier is a short stroll to the 19th Hole (restaurant and bar), under ten minutes to Ballarat and approximately 20 minutes to Daylesford. Boasting three large bedrooms and a stunning open plan kitchen, meals & lounge the quality of finish matches the lifestyle granted. The kitchen's splashback has to be seen to be believed. The stainless steel appliances including the 900mm upright stove will please. With the living area facing North East it chases the sun, while ample heating and cooling deliver all year comfort. So if you love golf, nature or beautiful scenic walks this home is for you.
Insights: 3 The Boardwalk, Creswick VIC 3363 was last sold in 2018 and 45 other 3 bedroom house in Creswick have recently been sold.

Both town water and power is available along with a current planning permit. With a flat building site and great fertile land be quick to grab this opportunity whilst it still exists. Call today to find out more.

Description:
10 ACRE FARMLET - QUALITY LAND WITH SENSATIONAL VIEWS
Perfect small farmlet centrally located with easy access to Daylesford, Creswick & Ballarat. The partly renovated home is nicely positioned within an established treed setting and comprises 4 bedrooms plus spacious open plan kitchen/dining/living. The property is set-up perfectly for horses with various sheds, day yards, stables, dressage arena and 2 well fenced paddocks of approx 4 acres each. The property has amazing distant views over surrounding farmland and is ideal for anyone looking for a quiet country lifestyle, but still wishing to be close to town / city services and facilities. Inspect by appointment.
Mark Timmins : 0488 547 004

Description:
INVITING LIFESTYLE - INVITING SETTING - SPACIOUS HOME - 16 ACRES
Located at Evansford, some 15 minutes to Clunes, is this appealing property with a 30 sq (approx) double brick family home with 16 acres, great shedding, studio/bungalow, quiet location & an inviting tranquil setting. This property offers so much for all of the family with 4 or 5 bedrooms or 4 & a study, great kitchen with butler's pantry, formal dining, formal lounge, family meals area, 2 outdoor entertaining areas, master bedroom with ensuite with spa bath, cathedral ceilings & presentation plus throughout. Outside there is a studio/bungalow (currently used as a craftroom), established gardens, massive amounts of shedding, chook run, 3 dams & 16 acres for horses or livestock. Add only 15 minutes to Clunes, 20 minutes to Maryborough & 30 minutes to Ballarat & this is a must see country property. Phone now!

Description:
Historical Renovated Cottage, Circa 1850's On 4 Acres
Situated in the small country hamlet of Glendaruel between Mount Beckworth and Mount Bolton. 25 minutes drive to Ballarat, 10 minutes to Clunes and 15 minutes to the Western Freeway via Miners Rest. This historic former post office consists of 4 bedrooms and 2 separate living rooms. Original features include polished floor boards, open fireplaces, galley style kitchen with pantry and large meals area. There is an updated bathroom with toilet. Outside offers a quality 2 roomed studio with split system heating that could easily be used as another bedroom and living zone. The approximately 4 acres parcel of land is comprised of both cleared and classic cottage garden areas, 2 grazing paddocks, and numerous fruit trees including apple, nectarine, peach, plum. A fantastic bonus of this property is the great stock and domestic bore which provides abundant water for all the garden. Sundry shedding, garage with direct house entry, 44000 litres of tank water, chook/dog run and a meandering creek complete this lifestyle package. A unique property that demands your inspection. Call today.
Insights: 1368 Coghills Creek Road, Glendaruel VIC 3363 was last sold in 2016.

Address: 1365 McCallums Creek Rd, RED LION Talbot VIC 3371
Description:
DID YOU ORDER A HOME WITH VIEWS?
Set in an elevated position with sweeping views is this charming three bedroom weatherboard home, situated on 3 acres (approx.) This stunning home was relocated here around 4 years ago with the benefit of being fully rejuvenated in the process, whilst still keeping some original features of sash windows and ornate cornices. Living room with views over the mountains featuring a split system, wood fire and ceiling fan. Adjoining is the updated kitchen with breakfast bar, near new stainless steel appliances, dishwasher, double sink and electric cooking. Washing up won't be a chore while taking in the magnificent views from the kitchen window. Three bedrooms, main with floor to ceiling BIRs. Family bathroom with bath and vanity. Laundry with shower and separate toilet. Outside there is a spacious bungalow with living area, wood heater, fans, shower and toilet. 2 x 25,000 litre water tanks, bore, chook pen, dog run, raised veggie gardens, mains and solar power, fruit trees and much more.
Contact Alisa Johnson at our Maryborough office on 0409935766.
Alisa Johnson : 0409 935 766

Description:
POSITIONED PERFECT IN HISTORICAL TALBOT
Situated in the centre of historical Talbot, just a stone's throw to the local pub, library and post office and in a prime position for the famous Talbot Farmers Market is this two bedroom updated clad home. The home is surrounded by historical buildings dating back to the 1860s when Talbot was once a thriving gold mining town. The home was rebuilt in around 2010 and now sits on a concrete slab floor, has a new roof and is updated throughout to make it a low maintenance home. Step inside to the generous living room with a cozy wood fire, ceiling fans and airconditioner. Off the living area there are two double bedrooms with ceiling fans. The bathroom is tiled with bath, large shower, vanity and IXL. The open plan kitchen and dining is to the back of the home with dishwasher, gas cooking and gas heater. Located on a generous allotment 855m2 (approx.) with rear gate access, a garage and single carport there is plenty of room for parking. Don't let this little beauty pass you by and arrange an inspection today.
Contact Alisa Johnson at our Maryborough Office on 0409935766.
Alisa Johnson : 0409 935 766

Description:
Charismatic Victorian Makes A Great Port-folio Addition
This delightful Victorian home has more than meets the eye. The abode boasts four bedrooms giving the occupier loads of options of what to utilise as bedrooms, study or gaming rooms. The timber kitchen is was updated recently, but still fits in with the feel of the home. The abode has some modern comforts as well, including reverse cycle air-conditioning. The small and low maintenance yard is perfect for the busy couple or the investor wanting a tidy addition to the port-folio. It's locale on the main street of town has its one minute to the hub and its shops & facilities. The residence has been recently let for $250p/w, a nice return indeed. The township is friendly and has all you need. Just 10 minutes to either Clunes or Ballarat, it also make an entertaining place to be, without the huge price tag.

Description:
Building block, north facing 2000 square metre block on high side of road, in town boundary
A 2063 square metre ( half acre ) building block close to Creswick town centre, featuring underground power, Ballarat town water, sewerage,etc.
A gently sloping block on high side of road with northerly aspect, close to RACV Goldfields resort hotel, which features an international standard golf course (just a very short walk from the block).
This ideal location is just ten minutes from Ballarat, also Creswick has a direct train service to Melbourne, and an airport shuttle bus service is available from RACV hotel.
This block of land is north facing and is in a very sheltered location, also in a pleasant area surrounded by quality homes.

With a tranquil setting, this home has plenty to offer with 2 large bedrooms, smaller third bedroom/bungalow/studio, updated kitchen with new electric stove, new bathroom & formal lounge with country views & polished hardwood floors. Outside, this property offers tank & bore water, dam, 2 stables, day yard, dog & chook runs, elovatored located to enjoy the views & an inviting driveway entrance - this affordable country package is complete. Phone now for more details.

Description:
Vale Hill circa 1858
***CURRENTLY UNDER OFFER***
This unique & remarkable property, set on 10 acres in the pastoral heart of VictoriaÂ´s Goldfields region has undergone an amazing transformation located only minutes from Daylesford, Ballarat, Creswick & Clunes yet boasting absolute privacy. Featuring 4 bedrooms, 3 bathrooms, 2 kitchens & a spectacular double-height entrance foyer, Vale Hill House is a superb combination of late 1850's bluestone and-brick & contemporary architect design.
Comfortable living spaces, showcasing bespoke interior design by the late Stuart Rattle, complement stunning outdoor entertaining areas, including a 30 metre pergola with uninterrupted views of the surrounding countryside. A self-contained barn conversion, refurbished outbuildings & 160 year old wine cellar complete the estate. High-spec throughout, the property is serviced by a C-bus electrical system and wireless high speed NBN connection. The house is warmed by a combination of under-floor heating, open fireplaces and split-system units. Power is augmented by 4.8kw solar panels and there is an onsite bore and 64,000-litre water tanks.
Set amongst beautiful landscaped grounds, Vale Hill House includes an edible garden featuring 100's of fruiting trees & raised vegetable plots. A true dream home or special getaway retreat, Vale Hill House is a place to be treasured, & an acquisition to be envied.
For more information visit: www.valehill.com.au/house/
Conjunctional Agent:
Biggin & Scott (Daylesford) - (03) 5348 2328
Tom Shaw 0438 118 903
Michael De Vincentis 0417 142 152

Address: Lot 129/218 Eastern Hill Road Blampied VIC 3364
Description:
UNIQUE 100 ACRES WITH PLANNING PERMIT
Your journey through the undulating pastures of Blampied, just 10 minutes west of Daylesford, will not prepare you for this stunning property. Formed by ancient volcanic activity, this rich farmland plateau changes dramatically to reveal a deep forest valley with rocky outcrops, a long creek boundary and breathtaking views in every direction. Inspection by advance appointment only.
-100 acres with stunning views in every direction - north along the valley, south over peaceful farming land, forest areas to the east, and west towards the volcanic hills of Smeaton and Kooroocheang
-Recently issued planning permit for residence
-Long eastern boundary to Deep Creek
-Resident eagles often sighted circling over the valley or resting on the hillside
-Groundwater bore. Power available, but ideal for off grid living
-400m private access road from Eastern Hill Rd

Description:
A home in the country!
Located within the quiet town of Newlyn, this property is easy commuting distance to Ballarat (20 minutes), Daylesford (15 minutes) and Creswick (7 minutes). Set on 1512sqm of land, the home comprises of a large bedroom with an adjacent second bedroom and a third separate bedroom. A generously proportioned lounge area sits next to the open plan kitchen and family meals area and there is a centrally located bathroom. Outside the property is well fenced and a deck overlooks the impressive views over the surrounding farmland. Features of note include a garden shed, air conditioning, mains water fresh carpet and fresh paint.

Description:
PEACEFUL RURAL PROPERTY
Large block of 4371m2 (1.081 acres), offering a beautiful rural aspect with views of the Blue Pyrenees.
The land is flat to undulating. It is fenced and is on one title (Zoned: Rural). There are no services to the block.
The block is cleared and large enough to have your farm pets, or grow some organic vegetables in the rich soil.
Situated close to the Ballarat-Maryborough Road for easy access to Talbot and surrounding historic towns. School bus is nearby for lovely country primary school, or high school in Maryborough.
This economically priced block awaits your purchase. Enquire today.

Description:
Country Home On 5 Acres
You just want to get your hands on this and turn it into your own! Set on approx. 5 acres, just five minutes from Creswick, 90 minutes to Melbourne and a scenic drive to Castlemaine, Bendigo or Ballarat, this thriving artistic community also provides proximity benefits to Daylesford just twenty minutes away.
Framed by beautiful native trees and offering a perfect mix of bushland and cleared spaces, this property offers , a three bedroom home and a myriad of sheds. With a little TLC, the home could be transformed into a fabulous country home with a separate dining room, lounge, rumpus and the comfort of wood heating and split system. The kitchen is open in design with a dishwasher, cooker and storage, while the family room offers high cathedral style ceilings, raw floors and a brick feature wall to compliment the earthy vistas outdoors. All bedrooms have been uplifted with smoky walls and window furnishings, while the floors are ready to be finished and styled with some cosy lush carpet.
Various sheds provide room for vehicles and/or storage, while a high clearance shed offers room for boats, caravans and/or machinery, while a further double bay shed, workshop, a dam and large paddock provide room to utilize your hobby farming essentials. Eight solar panels and 2 x 20,000L water tanks contribute to the running costs, while the fully fenced back yard encircle children or pets for safety and protection. A chicken coup and an enclosed vegetable garden also add self sufficiency to this fabulous purchase.
If you are looking for a renovating project, or even contemplating a country B & B, this property offers numerous buildings, space for animals and the bones to begin your dream. An interesting property with fascinating appeal! Call today for further details.

Description:
Go Bush on approximately 9.5 acres
Get away from it all and get back to nature with your very own piece of country camping. This treed property features a 9x6m shed with double glass door, some kitchen benching and pot belly heating. The corner opening double doors with paved flooring extending out to the wide veranda on 2 sides a bonus for easy access for larger items. Also included is a 5,000 gal water tank plus 2 dams for water supply. Good fencing. Zoned Farming. Close to Talbot in the heart of the Victorian Goldfields, .
To arrange inspection of this great little property please call Jo Millar on 0348 081 301 or Angela Flowers on 0437 456 908

Description:
Country Lifestyle - 60 acres approx.
* Situated in the Talbot/Avoca area is this lovely farmlet situated in a private valley with views to the Pyrenees.
* An undulating and mostly cleared block surrounded by State Forest.
* Comfortable 3 bedroom brick veneer home with a northerly aspect.
* 2 Living areas.
* Spacious living room with cathedral ceilings and solid fuel heater.
* External improvements include 2 dams, dog yards with runs, double lock-up garage, open machinery shed and mains power.

Description:
QUALITY THREE BEDROOM HOME IN THE HEART OF TALBOT
Set in the heart of Talbot is this beautiful three bedroom home. Set on a large block with rear access and plenty of room for the kids to run, inspection is sure to impress.
The generous lounge room with quality carpets, free standing wood heater and split system leads to the dining area and kitchen. This home is filled with natural light and is light and airy.
The kitchen has an abundance of storage and good bench space with easy access to the outdoor entertaining area. Two of the three bedrooms enjoy large BIR's and have easy access to the bathroom with separate shower and bath, there is also a separate toilet.
There is a single carport, garage/workshop and a wood shed. Both front and back yards are neat and tidy and are often commented on by passers-by. This home is located only a few minutes' walk to local schools and general store.
Enjoy all that is on offer here, contact LUKE WILLIAMS on 0415 104 044 to book your inspection.
Luke Williams : 0415 104 044

Description:
Fabulous Family Home & Shedding To Please Tradesperson
This sweet Victorian has more than meets the eye. The home with a 20 year old extension now offers four bedrooms, a vast living room and a sunny kitchen. The kitchen is also large and extremely functional with great bench space, while being open plan to the lounge. A perfect entertainer your guest can flow from big living out to the paved pergola area. A car collector or tradesperson will be delighted by the amazing car coverage. The abode sits in a generous allotment in a quiet street just two minutes from the hub of town.
